#Text=Labour grabs poll lead in UK General Election campaign
#Text=Friday , April 10 , 2015
#Text=Labour leader Ed Miliband .
#Text=Image : Department of Energy .

#Text=The approval ratings of UK Labour leader Ed Miliband rose above those of his Conservative opponent , David Cameron , for the first time in this year 's bitterly fought general election campaign .
#Text=The poll results showed support for the Labour Party was also rising .
#Text=A poll by Panelbase yesterday showed Labour six points ahead ; a similar survey by Survation for the Daily Mirror showed Labour four points ahead of the Conservatives .

#Text=This latter poll was mixed for the Labour leader as it showed only 25 % of voters were convinced Miliband was suited to the job of Prime Minister while 37 % preferred David Cameron , but it also shows that people preferred Miliband 's recent conduct as party leader to Cameron 's .
#Text=A poll by TNS found a three point lead for Labour .
#Text=ComRes
#Text=polling indicated the eventual outcome of the election is too close to call , projecting the Conservatives with 34 % of the vote and Labour 33 % .
#Text=Following the poll results , the Conservative Party fired a volley of negative remarks towards Labour .

#Text=Defense secretary Michael Fallon said Ed Miliband would end up signing up for " a grubby backstairs deal " with the Scottish National Party ( SNP ) which would lead to the cancellation or non-renewal of the Trident nuclear submarine programme .

column1: #Text=The Labour Party have stated they support the continuation of Trident and will not negotiate on Trident with the SNP .
#Text=Fallon 's comments on Trident were backed up by David Cameron .
#Text=The Labour Party counter-claimed a deal between the Conservatives and Liberal Democrats had put the cost of Trident renewal up by £ 1.4bn .
#Text=Miliband responded to Fallon 's comments :
#Text=" Michael Fallon is a decent man , but today I think he has demeaned himself and he has demeaned his office .

#Text= The Tories were up to their old tricks in their personal attack on Ed this morning .

_	_	_	_

#Text=Liberal Democrat Vince Cable expressed his displeasure at Fallon 's remarks , saying it was  an appalling way to conduct the argument " .

column1: #Text=The two main parties have also proposed a number of new ideas for policy .

#Text=Labour 's Yvette Cooper is to formally announce a new policy today to protect 10,000 police officers ' jobs by eliminating elected Police and Crime Commissioners and gun licensing subsidy , and sharing of police back-office services and procurement .

#Text=The Labour crime and justice manifesto also includes creating a new commission on sexual and domestic violence , banning " legal highs " , and reforming prisons to introduce more education and work for prisoners .

#Text=Conservative Cameron pre-announced a proposal to change the rules so workers in the public sector and for companies with 250 employees or more — which between the two is estimated to be around half the work force — would be entitled to three days of paid volunteering leave per year .
#Text=In prepared remarks , Cameron is to call the move represents the " clearest demonstration of the Big Society in action " .

column1: #Text=This marks a return of the language of the ' Big Society ' which had slowly disappeared from use since the last election .
